author: .vbuterin
content: Although, I feel like especially at current high-gasprice conditions, the amount miners gain by pushing the gaslimit up from tips is less than the amount miners would gain in the status-quo regime by fiddling with the gaslimit to find the (gaslimit * gasprice) maximizing point

author: .vbuterin
content: 1 gwei * 20 million gas is only 0.02 ETH, 1% of the block reward

author: phabc
content: Fair enough, revenue could be so small miners don't bother, though that's also an argument for why miners may not care about txs at all if it's trivial revenue. Either they care about fee revenue and try to maximize it or they don't care and might even ignore txs to reduce chance of being uncled.
